reviews.title: All Fur Coat & No Drawers
reviews.text: My wife & I stayed at Eden for a week from November 1st - 8th. It cost £250 per person flying from Belfast & was booked through Fleetway travel on teletext who we thought were very efficient. Now lets get down to the nitty gritty of reviewing this place.

reviews.title: Great value for the money
reviews.text: Location: Eden is located slightly outside Albufeira town. We walked into town many times & I would say it never took any longer than 15mins. You could do it in 10 mins if you were really in a hurry but then if it was really hot the going might be a bit slower. On the way back it is a good uphill walk & the whole time we were there I never once seen anyone walking back up the hill except us. In the event that the hill does prove to much for some then the taxi varies from €3.50 - €5 depending on the driver you get. To get into Albufeira just leave reception, keep walking down hill untill you reach the round-a-bout, turn right & keep walking. There is a super market at the bottom of the hill from the resort. At the round-a-bout just look across the road & its there. There is also a Lidl if you get to the bottom of the hotel hill, cross the road & follow the road back up the hill & turn right (car or taxi needed for that).

reviews.title: Terrible Food And Ignorant Female Reception Staff
reviews.text: Food: I can't comment on the food as we were staying self catering. From talking with other guests though the reports were not good. There is a large area where everyone eats & I popped my head in one day & it was like feeding time at the zoo.

reviews.title: Not So Garden of Eden
reviews.text: Entertainment: There was no entertainment in the Apple Bar at the resort. There was a Michael Jackson cd they seemed to play over & over again though for the guests! It looked a dead enough affair.

reviews.title: PLEASANTLY SUPRISED!
reviews.text: Staff: On check in the girl on reception could'nt care less. It was almost like it was just to much effort for the girl to book us in. She was on the phone to someone so maybe we were interupting her social life! We arrived at 1:15pm. Basically told to leave the bags & come back at 2pm as the appartment not ready. Fair enough as check in is at 2pm. Cleaning staff seem friendly enough. Spa staff are a mixed bag. I will get to that below.

We rented a villa for 1 week, and unfortunately true that from the first day one dirty, hair all over the house, floor, toilets ect. and otherwise absolutely filthy. We complained two days and talked to the manager he said that he has no time. the cleaning is also done only at 17.00 pm. (if you can call it clean). We are totally disappointed with the whole management to the Interesiert of the customer. Also the pool was complet dirty, i live in a clean house, and when I do travel, I expect the same from the hotel that's clean, something bad and dirty, I've never seen around the world. We moved out after 2 days. NEVER MORE.
reviews.title: Schöne Anlage aber Dreckig !!!

reviews.text: The 2 bed apartment was great and it was our 3rd time here in a year. The cleaning was done every day,but the floors do need cleaned properly more often.As for the complaints about the reception staff,have never had a problem and always found them very helpful.Great place for a family.
reviews.title: " Great"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights October half term 2012, the setting is beautiful and the apartments were 1st class. We had a ground floor apartment which was well equipped and very modern. We arrived 10.30am and check in wasn't until 4pm but they did speed things up and our room was ready by 12.30 ish. The breakfast was ok plenty to go around usual stuff salad, fruit and bacon etc.Evening meals were a different matter though, queuing to get in first because our experience was that the food ran out about 8. O clock, but the food was very restricted and never hot! The restaurant was a bit like a holiday camp canteen, queuing again while holding your plates! This is the first time we have gone abroad so late so was a little worried about the weather and oh my god we should have been worried, we had torrential rain off and on the whole time. Out of our 4 days we had about 3 hours to be able to sit by the pool, no one can be blamed for the weather but it does ruin what should have been a well earned break. We had to go with the flow and spent a lot of time in the town centre, which was full of restaurants and bars. There is a free shuttle bus from Eden resort during the day into town which was good but a nightmare to come back as it only carried 6 people and there were about 20 plus waiting to come back which resulted in my pet hate (queue jumpers!!!!). To evaluate, firstly if you want peace and quiet the complex is great but go self catering, there is a supermarket at the bottom of a steep hill. If you want entertainment we can't comment because we had none, it appeared to have finished at the end of the summer. The only place to sit and have a drink was in what appeared to be a kids room with pool table and you had to drink out of plastic. Overall a bit disappointing due to weather and there not being anything to do on and around the complex, but to add some praise staff were friendly and the grounds pruned to almost perfection.
reviews.title: Accommodation excellent - rest is lacking!!!!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here from 16-23rd October and enjoyed our stay. I Would recommend this resort for a relaxing stay in Albufeira. There is very little to do in the hotel if the weather isn't great which it wasn't a few times in the week we were there so we took the free bus into the town. Entertainment is on three times a week in the small kiosk bar which is understaffed and pretty crowded at times. We ended up providing our own entertainment most of the time or heading into the old town to one of the many cocktail bars. The apartments themselves are very modern and well equipped, i cannot fault them. The pool bar closed on our second day and didnt open again which was a pity as we were all inclusive and it was handy having the bar so close. Staff here are overworked and work very long hours, they do need to smile a bit more but they are definitely understaffed. I was disappointed with the food, it is like a canteen, there is little atmosphere in the restaurant and food is bland and repetitive. Snacks however were good. We did really enjoy our stay here and I do recommend the resort for a cheap all inclusive holiday but it wouldn't be 4 star in my opinion. . We had a massage in the spa, i must admit the girl in the spa was very unfriendly and did not make the experience overly relaxing or enjoyable. I think this resort has great potential with more staff and better customer services it could be really excellent as the apartments themselves are great and the location is good.
reviews.title: Lovely resort in Albufeira

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from eden resort on the 18th of october as other people have said we went with a open mind after reading some reviews and i am sad to say we where dissapointed although i must say the apartments are very good and there is everything you will need and top quality for self cattering unfortunatly we went all inclusive also the staff where excellent and very hard worked and always had a smile on there faces now the bad bits some people say that the restaraunt was like a canteen this is exactly what its like when it was full the noise was loud to say the least the food was very restricted breakfast was ok lunch and dinner was a selection of 1 meat 1 fish dish sometimes potatoes and veg always chips all meals where only warm at best there was 2 types of cake same cake every night fruit and icecream this was your desert there was also salad but as one of our party had salad one night and was up all night being sick and another of the party had the salad the next night with the same sickness we give it a miss after that can i say again the staff in the restaraunt worked hard and although there was only 2 or 3 there i never saw a table with dirty dishes on the apple bar on a night was closed so everybody had to sit in the cafe where there was never enough chairs or tables and with there been no carpets on the floor the place was like a echo chamber and if somebody was sat next to you you could'nt hear a word they where saying after a couple of nights of this we had enough and went into the town i hope you don't think that i am a moan if you look at my past reviews you will see this is the first review that i have put anything negative about anywhere we have stopped this could be a great resort if managment got there finger out and got the place organised i have tryed to be as honest as i can my tip GO SELF CATTERING
reviews.title: great for self cattering

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a week's All Inclusive at Eden Resort last year and decided it was excellent for SC but the place isn't really set up for All Inclusive. We wanted a change from AI and knew that Eden would be ideal. We booked a 2 bed apartment as we knew these are on the ground floor with a terrace onto the garden with lovely wicker sun loungers and table/chairs. The holiday was everything we expected it to be - the apartment was again beautiful, very comfortable with lounge, dining area, kitchen, 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Kitchen was well equiped with top of the range appliances: oven/hob, large fridge freezer, microwave, dishwasher. I brought my own sponge, dishcloths, etc, the only thing missing was oven gloves. The resort is lovely with well kept gardens. There is a supermarket just down the hill which was well stocked and a Lidl nearby also. We found prices very good and selection plentiful. Alfufeira old town is only 15mins walk, and it's only about 5 euro for a taxi with good selection of restaurants, even out of season - we found eating out also surprisingly inexpensive.
reviews.title: Excellent for self catering

reviews.text: Particular recommendation goes to A Cocheira, which is very near Eden if you don't fancy going into town - excellent welcome from this family run restaurant, lovely food and atmosphere, also very inexpensive. Definitely worth a visit.
reviews.title: The packaging is lovely but what's inside is a bit of a mess

reviews.text: We will definitely return on SC basis, this is ideal if you want a relaxing holiday in a well appointed apartment for a very good price.
reviews.title: Lovely apartments.

reviews.text: As a group of 30 something women we decided a girls holiday was in need and I found a great deal for the Eden resort. It is listed as a 5* resort....it's really not.
reviews.title: Brilliant value for money.

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong the surroundings are amazing the gardens and pools are so well kept and its really peaceful and from the outside the Eden resort looks incredible but thats just the packaging....The rest isnt so good!
reviews.title: Great area and apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you'll see in most of the reviews the accommodation is stunning, especially the 2 bed ground floor apartments, which we had, which have 2 bathrooms and sun loungers outside. The resort is not designed as an All Inclusive resort - the resort was built as properties for sale, and they are obviously trying to recoup some of their costs by offering AI/SC to holidaymakers. The food is OK - all good quality, if somewhat bland, breakfast is probably the best meal of the day with excellent choice. If you're not a fussy eater you can usually find something to eat - and I liked the provision of a microwave to give your plateful a quick blast to ensure it's hot enough. Nice fresh salads and excellent fruit. The AI choice of drinks is also good. The downsides are the restaurant is a bit canteen-like and the bar in the evening is too small - all in all not really enough quality public areas. As we were there out of season the pool bar was closed which would have been a nicer area to sit at during the day - although we often spent time on our sun loungers outside our apartment, which was great. The grounds are beautiful and pristine. Only a 20 minute walk to the old town, and there is a courtesy bus which goes several times a day (which we didn't use) - taxi is only 4 or 5 euro. It wasn't ideal, but we were only looking for a quiet week in the sun and it was really cheap - we paid under £600 for the two of us for the week! It's ideal if you go into town occasionally for lunch or dinner for a change - I might not return AI but would definitely return for Self Catering as the resort is stunning.
reviews.title: Accommodation 5*, AI 3* - but excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think a few of you need a reality check... try considering what you paid and what you got for that money - then spend a couple of weeks searching the UK and the rest of europe for anything thats anywhere near as good value. I see a lot of the negative 'Brits abroad' have failed to mention they probably only paid 3* price but then again some of you just live to moan and complain dont you.. personally I dont see why some of you dont just stay at home.. if you want an action packed fun filled non stop resort then dont go... if you want a relaxing base from which to enjoy a few days away in some very nice accomodation with the option to explore then its perfect.
reviews.title: Honeymoon 22nd - 26th November

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are no surprises, everything is as described on the brochure includnig location, facilities, services etc. The all inclusive range of food is exactly what you would expect from AI, hot buffet, self service.... if you want table service and everything cooked to your exact requirements then dont go all inclusive its really as simple as that. The difference between s/c and AI for us was about £10 per day, if you have brekkie, a few drinks whether it be alcohol, soft, tea or coffee during the day and at least 1 other meal or snack then its paid for itself. There was a huge choice FRESH fruit, fish, veg every day with at least 1 salad, pasta, meat, fish choice every day as well as a couple of things for the kids. If your still so fussy that this didnt please you there was also the snack options and if that still didnt please you then take your sour face off into town and enjoy one of the many eateries down there..... just remember to pay your whopping bill at the end. If that didnt please you then as I said earlier, stay at home... sure you'll find all of your usual British dishes there.
reviews.title: 5 start from start to finnish
Definately not "Heaven on Earth"
reviews.text: ACCOMODATION, excellent, well equipped, warm, spacious.
CLEANING, fine, no issue.... how often do some of you clean your house and change your sheets in 1 week? Why should you expect it any more while away?
reviews.title: Fantastic Resort- Shame about the other guests!!

reviews.text: We have just returned from the Eden resort and all in all it was good value for money. The resort is run on a major shoe string and they where obviously running the site down for winter. Most facilities where closed which was disappointing, but the whole site was nicely kept. The cleaners could do more, and the day they did turn up one of us slipped on the moped floor. The food was fair to good, the salad choice was always nice and fresh and the cooked selection not bad either. Top tip get in early for breakfast as food runs out and after 9 you just have to eat what's left. The same can be said for the evening meal.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

reviews.text: All in all you get what you pay for! Don't expect 5* accommodation at 3* prices. I like to add that we as a party would happily return again, hopefully with better weather!!!!
reviews.title: the good the bad and the...

reviews.text: Truth!!
reviews.title: Eden Resort October 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just returned from a 6 night stay at the Eden resort.
reviews.title: Half term break

reviews.text: quick summary
reviews.title: Fantastic but wasted!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the GOOD reviews on this resort a accurate, As for the negatives, well sorry the accomodation is brilliant, the cleaners were very good, the bar i will agree is a little uninviting, but that would be my only observation, the food was as you would expect from an all inclusive holiday, and for those that have complained about the food, I am sorry if it is not what you wanted on that day, but if you coulod not find something to eat from the very good selection, then I would put you in the typical BRIT abroad bracket, sorry if that offends, and please note the time of year we went!!!.
reviews.title: this is heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff are very hard working and a little thin on the ground, not there fault, however treat them with a little respect and you will reap the rewards, we had a great laugh with them, especially Carlos, so please be nice, and dont click your fingers, you will see the diffrence.
reviews.title: lovely break

reviews.text: Lovely appartments all to high spec,
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.text: we had two bedrooms, king-size bed, beautiful kitchen, neat grounds, sat T.V. (not much choice) but all in all a lovely room
reviews.title: Fabulous time.. But would return with a car and self catering!

reviews.text: Good choice of food and drink, but bar too small for the amount of people on site only ever one barman on duty to serve wash and collect glasses sometimes you were kept waiting
reviews.title: GREAT FIRST FAMILY HOLIDAY!!

reviews.text: Stayed here October half term firstly weather was awful ok so not hotels fault for that but no kids club was available rooms at first glance were nice or should of been nice but had dirty walls curtains hanging off and dirty floors and the couches were minging hated the thought of even sitting on them shame really because these apartments were obviously nice 2 years ago when they were built but have been left and ill be surprised if there still standing in 2 years .never went in the pool as weather wasn't good enough and the indoor one had strange opening hours .food omg what did they think they were serving to people it s awful we were all inclusive we didn't bother I would not give my animals the food that this hotel were offering people I stay at top 4 and 5 star hotels all the time I didn't expect too much from this hotel as it was a cheap easy jet holiday and believe me it didn't deliver ,I'm just very lucky that I've had other holidays this year so for us it was just a small break otherwise I would of been really upset as many people were .we came home 5 days early from this hotel the weather wasn't kind on us and if the hotel would of been of better quality we would of stayed .i would not recommend staying here looks like its run on a very tight budget looks reminded me of pontins even. Got the rain
reviews.title: Wouldn't give this place 3 star

reviews.text: This place is amazing! Came Oct 17th for 8 days with husband n 2 kids. Lovely and relaxing with lots of good walks. Supermaket 5 min walk from resort if self cat but we were half board. Food was very good, nothing was repeated twice. Our 2 bed ground floor apartment was amazing, very well equipt and great garden! Staff couldn't do enough to help especially Natasha the receptionist!
reviews.title: Well worth 4*'s

reviews.text: On arrival we thought it was beautiful. The grounds are well maintained, and nice. We were 4 adults and we rented a 2 bedroom apartment. When had read reviews and were aware of them not having hot water, and this was very true. We notified staff right away and they changed something and we then had hot water. I think they may turn the thermostat down to save on the heating, but most people dont complain...so let them know right away. The staff were hit and miss. A few were fab, and a few that were very aloof and just didn't seem to care. Internet was a joke. We paid 25 euro for the week, but this was only good for one device. So I wanted to use my device one day and purchased for the day and could not get any signal or connection. We did not go for the all inclusive, but did go for the meals on 2 nights. We paid 15 euro per person each night, and the food was average, good if you just didnt want to go into town. Very close to the beach, and the old town. Easy walk down hill, and a 3-5 euro taxi back up...well worth it. The store is very expensive on the resort. You are way better off going into town as there is a grocery store and you can find everything you need there. The only thing that was a bit of a let down was the pools were freezing. It was very hot, and we still couldn't enjoy a swim. We also found the beds to be a little uncomfortable, but we had been travelling for a few weeks at this point and I dont think anything but home would have been good. Both rooms had A/C which were great.
reviews.title: Just a few things....

reviews.text: Eden Resort Albufeira 5 Star (Per Easyjet Rating) is a joke!!! This is a total misrepresentation on the internet!!!
reviews.title: Awful! Awful! Awful!

reviews.text: Read all the recent reports and form your own own opinion but take our advice - don't even think about it!
reviews.title: Excellent facility
eden resort in november
reviews.text: This complex is what it says on the label a 5 star resort,the problem being it was built to function as a complex for people staying in their luxury apartments.Even though the staff try very hard the restaurant and especially the bar are to small.Their were not enough staff to cope with the amount of people that stayed when we were there in early November.The food is good but as in previous reports a lot of the food is only luke warm which is a shame,the selection is limited due only to the size of the serving and preparation area.But in summer with 4 pools to go at and a luxury apartment to stay in it could be most peoples heaven.A car i think is essential.

reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
reviews.text: I have recently just come back from the eden resort staying there from the 8th nov - 13th nov. The appartments i cannot fault they were finished to a very high standard & i would rate them 5* as for the rest of the resort i don't kno where to begin, the food was awful, on one occasion i had a chicken curry & needless to say it was still raw in the middle, on many occasion they had run out of food & were very reluctant to replace what had been eaten, as for desserts there was lack of choice & most of it still frozen. The bar was very small & had little seating for everybody & you wre waiting nearly 15-20mins to get served for drinks as they only had 1 barman! There was no entertainment & nothing for kids to do & they claimed you couldn't use the swimming pool with out wearing a swim hat in which they then decided to try & charge you for ( the pool was always empty!) The only other option of food was to head into town to a restaurant which was 15mins away, the town was very nice but very quiet due to time of year. Staff were not very welcoming or helpful so i will not be going here again & i'd advised u not to either as i think you'll be disappointed & you can get alot more for your money else where!

reviews.title: nice break
reviews.text: lovely appartments everything we needed ,it rained most of the which spolt the 5 days we were there ,we were a/inc and had a long walk back to the resterant ,we had no problem with the food ,cos it was raining there was not alot to do ,think you need to hire a car realy and maybe self catering ,were in 112 an it a fair walk in the rain for ur meals ,but i wud go back there again at a sunny time cos it is a lovely place .

reviews.title: complete chill-out!
reviews.text: Just got back from a 3 day break at the Eden, what can i say?. . . .went for a chill-out break and that is exactly what we got. Receptionist very polite and helpful, its not a massive resort but we were given a map and directions to our 2 bed apartment. Key card to get in and we were given a key each....which we have never had before. The apartment was outstanding, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms large living area and a very chic kitchen. Fridge, freezer, microwave, dishwasher, pots and pans, plates, cutlery etc all there...Also added bonus of iron and ironing board,..oh and a hairdryer. Because we had a 2 bed we had our own little garden with table and chairs and sun loungers. It wasnt quite the weather for a swim but the pools looked really nice, and there is a little lake where you can feed the fish.......We had the all in option which was great....loads of choice at breakfast. hot and cold buffet plus cereals and waffles......also lunch and dinner there was quite a variety. Went to the apple bar one night and although it a tad on the small side there are 2 outside areas. They had karoke on the night we were there and it was very enjoyable!

reviews.title: Brilliant holiday
reviews.text: The hotel lays on a mini bus to ferry you into the old town and runs 4times a days which is handy if you dont fancy the 20min walk. We ate out one night at the sweet garden, in the main square next door to the rock cafe...food was excellent, brilliant service and very reasonable.....would really recommend it if your out and about at night. There are still plenty of places open in the town at night, not like it was in august but still alot available but a more relaxed pace,
